intro: Monanthes microbotrys, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces unique, lantern-shaped seed pods that are often used in floral arrangements. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardeners interested in native plants.
